item.title: Playing with gganimate
item.description: Setup To get started, load the tidyverse (or just ggplot2) and gganimate. You can’t install gganimate from cran yet, so for now, you’ll need: # install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github('thomasp85/gganimate') library(tidyverse) library(gganimate) Basics of gganimate Here’s an canned example using the mtcars dataset. This uses states (i.e. categorical variables) for the transition. library(ggplot2) library(gganimate) ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), mpg, color = as.factor(cyl))) + geom_boxplot() + # Here comes the gganimate code transition_states( gear, transition_length = 2, state_length = 1 ) + enter_fade() + exit_shrink() + ease_aes('sine-in-out') Here’s another example looking at toothgrowth in guinea pigs fed either orange juice (OJ) or vitamin C supplement (VC) at increasing doses.
